intro: Anthistiria frondosa, commonly known as the fronded anthistiria, is a rare and specialized plant species found in specific alpine environments. It is characterized by its distinctive, fern-like fronds that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its reproductive structures are small and inconspicuous, relying on wind pollination for reproduction. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Anthistiria frondosa is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
